author: world today news
title: Iraq moves to attack Israel as Middle East becomes more vulnerable
text:
Jakarta – The Middle East is in turmoil after airstrikes kill Israel I am in Lebanon. Iraq they also moved to retaliate against Israel through the Anti-Islamic Group in Iraq which launched an attack on Israel’s Red Sea Port of Eliat.
Reported by AFP, Thursday (26/9/2024), Iraq attacked Israel’s Red Sea Port using a drone on Wednesday (25/9). Iraq claimed responsibility for the attack.
“The Islamic Resistance in Iraq attacked strategic targets in Eilat on Wednesday using drones,” he said in a statement published on Telegram.
SEVENTEEN
CHECK TO CONTINUE WITH INDEX
At the same time, the Israeli military said that they caught a drone approaching Eilat and that another one happened in the area. They said two people were slightly injured.
Israeli soldiers and tanks prepare to enter Lebanon As is known, the head of the Israeli army, General Herzi Halevi, said that the air attack on Lebanon prepared the way for a possible ground attack. He has told the Israeli army that airstrikes in Lebanon will continue to destroy Hezbollah’s infrastructure and pave the way for a possible ground attack.
“You can hear fighter jets overhead; we have been attacking all day,” General Herzi told soldiers on the border with Lebanon, according to a statement from the army, reported by AlJazeera, on Wednesday (25/9).
“This is to prepare the way for your possible entry and to continue reducing Hezbollah,” he said.
Meanwhile, Hezbollah says this is a war of calculation. They have been preparing for a possible land invasion since 2006. They have always said they are ready for any situation.
The leader of Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, was very clear in his speech a few days ago, saying that if Israel tries to put a buffer zone in southern Lebanon, they will fail.
In the last few minutes, at least two airstrikes were heard. The Israeli army announced that they were advancing on the province of Nabatieh. During the evening, there was an air raid.
Reportedly, two things happened in Lebanon: First, offensive airstrikes took place – designed to weaken Hezbollah’s infrastructure.
Then there was a reactive air attack – a series of Hezbollah rockets were heard entering Israel, about 15-20 minutes later, air attacks were seen in the area.
Watch video: Video of the moment Iraq attacked Israel with missile drones

2024-09-26 14:08:05
#Iraq #moves #attack #Israel #Middle #East #vulnerable

author: CakeJerry
title: ‎'Kamen Rider OOO 10th: The Core Medals of Resurrection' review by CakeJerry • Letterboxd
text:
This review may contain spoilers. I can handle the truth.
CakeJerry’s review published on Letterboxd:
This review may contain spoilers.
Went into this movie with low expectations due to the sheer backlash I've seen this movie get. But now that I've watched it, I honestly really enjoyed it. I definitely prefer the series ending being left as it is, but it's still enjoyable as a fanservice reunion movie.
Of course, the most controversial aspect of the movie is the way it kills off Eiji. On one hand, it feels like a backtrack from him learning to accept help from others instead of taking everything on himself. But on the other, with his renewed desire to save others, in the specific circumstance of him traveling alone, I can see how he would be pushed to sacrifice himself if it was the only way to save someone.
However, the way they execute it at the very end of the movie just felt needlessly harsh. It just slams the movie to a screeching halt in a way that feels like a ploy for shock value, reminding me of a certain shitty Zero-One V-cinema. Thankfully, this movie as a whole is much more enjoyable than that one.
The new suit designs really help to carry this movie. The King OOO suit is super rad, as is his upgrade form. The Tajador Eternity suit is gorgeous and has one of the most amazing henshin sequences I've ever seen. But my favorite of the new suits is Birth X. Just a stunning design.
At the end of the day, a majority of the movie is just fight scenes and seeing these old characters reunite again, so even with its story flaws, the movie is never boring. Eiji and Ankh's scenes together were as heartfelt and emotional as I could have possibly expected. Tajador Eternity is powered by pure gay love.
This movie is the ultimate example of why the endings of Rider seasons are best left as they are, but also of how these fanservice movies can be highly enjoyable when enjoyed for what they are and not regarded as canon.

author: @ChristianPost
title: Las fuerzas rusas capturaron y mataron al menos a 29 líderes religiosos desde que comenzó la guerra en Ucrania: funcionario
text: Las fuerzas rusas capturaron y mataron al menos a 29 líderes religiosos desde que comenzó la guerra en Ucrania: funcionario Soldados y funcionarios de ocupación rusos han cometido al menos 76 actos de persecución religiosa en Ucrania desde la invasión de febrero de 2022 como parte de un intento de destruir la identidad nacional, dijeron fuentes oficiales y eclesiásticas en la Cumbre Internacional de Libertad Religiosa. Desde la invasión, los cristianos evangélicos, incluidos los bautistas, pentecostales y adventistas del séptimo día, han sufrido mucho, dijo el comisionado del Parlamento para los Derechos Humanos en Ucrania, Dmytro Lubinets, a los participantes en la cumbre, que tuvo lugar en Washington, DC, el martes y miércoles. “El ejército ruso ha amenazado repetidamente con la eliminación física total de todos los creyentes evangélicos, llamándolos espías estadounidenses, sectarios y enemigos del pueblo ortodoxo ruso”, dijo Lubinets en una mesa redonda el martes. "Para matar a una persona, para demoler una iglesia, los rusos hacen todo lo posible para destruirnos como nación". Citando los 76 casos de persecución desde la invasión, Lubinets dijo que soldados y funcionarios rusos han matado o capturado al menos a 29 clérigos o líderes religiosos en Ucrania desde febrero de 2022, y agregó que esta cifra representa solo los casos verificados, y el número real es mucho mayor. Además de detenciones arbitrarias, violaciones, torturas y amenazas de asesinato, dijo, “los ocupantes simulan tiroteos y amenazan con ejecutar a miembros de la familia. Estas personas están detenidas en condiciones inhumanas, sin agua ni comida, e incluso sin acceso a un baño”. Mykhailo Brytsyn, pastor en Ucrania hasta que los soldados rusos irrumpieron en un servicio de adoración y cerraron su iglesia, dijo que todas las iglesias en las ciudades ocupadas por Rusia están cerradas. "La mayoría de los sacerdotes y pastores como yo hemos sido amenazados, intimidados, humillados, detenidos, golpeados y deportados", dijo el pastor Brytsyn a los participantes de la cumbre. “Algunos sacerdotes y creyentes todavía se encuentran hoy en las cárceles rusas. Algunos de ellos fueron asesinados”. Lubinets dijo que una de las primeras cosas que hacen los soldados rusos cuando capturan una ciudad es destruir los edificios de las iglesias, “excepto uno, y también obligan a todos los ciudadanos a ir a ella”. En noviembre de 2022, un diácono de una iglesia evangélica y su hijo fueron encontrados muertos a tiros en una zona forestal de la parte ocupada por Rusia de la región de Kherson, pocos días después de haber sido secuestrados por soldados rusos, dijo. “En agosto de 2023, los rusos atacaron la parroquia católica romana de Skadovs'k en la región de Kherson”, añadió Lubinets. “A los feligreses se les dijo que se trataba de una operación antiterrorista especial. Hay muchas historias de este tipo”. Desde febrero de 2022, Rusia ha dañado o destruido más de 600 edificios religiosos, incluidos los de comunidades protestantes, judías, católicas y musulmanas, afirmó. "El mayor número de edificios religiosos destruidos se encuentra en los territorios temporalmente ocupados de las regiones de Donetsk y Lugansk", dijo Lubinets. Un informe de noviembre de la Iniciativa de Libertad Religiosa de Mission Eurasia, EE.UU., encontró que la invasión provocó daños en al menos 630 estructuras religiosas, incluidas 206 casas de oración evangélicas. Entre las bases ideológicas de los ataques rusos contra objetivos religiosos se encuentra el objetivo de destruir una cultura ucraniana que ahora se enorgullece de la libertad de religión y los valores democráticos, afirma el informe. Después de que estalló el movimiento separatista respaldado por Rusia en 2014, “las figuras religiosas ucranianas y la mayoría de las comunidades religiosas en las regiones de Donetsk y Luhansk controladas por Rusia sufrieron una persecución brutal”, afirma el informe. "La única excepción fue la Iglesia Ortodoxa Ucraniana, afiliada al Patriarcado de Moscú, que gozaba de inmunidad ya que apoyaba a los separatistas controlados por Rusia". Los funcionarios de ocupación rusos percibieron a los miembros de la Iglesia Ortodoxa de Ucrania, la Iglesia greco-católica ucraniana y las iglesias evangélicas como agentes enemigos y espías de los servicios de inteligencia ucranianos o estadounidenses, afirma el informe. En febrero-marzo de 2022, los soldados rusos estaban preparados para perseguir a los seguidores religiosos. “Los propagandistas rusos comenzaron a acusar a figuras religiosas ucranianas de organizar una resistencia armada”, afirma el informe. “Sacerdotes y pastores fueron acusados infundadamente de cooperar con el Servicio de Seguridad de Ucrania, almacenar armas, transportar explosivos o convocar a un levantamiento armado contra las autoridades de ocupación”. Viktor Zelenskyi, jefe del Servicio Estatal de Ucrania para Asuntos Étnicos y Libertad de Conciencia ante el Consejo de Ministros, dijo a los participantes de la Cumbre de la IRF que la invasión rusa de Ucrania provocó atrocidades como el asesinato de sacerdotes, pastores, imanes y sus esposas. “Cuando pregunté a los pastores que fueron perseguidos en la región de Kiev durante los dos meses de ocupación del territorio de Kiev por qué los soldados rusos estaban tan enojados y eran tan brutales con los lugares religiosos, uno dijo: 'Odian la libertad, y realmente odian las libertades; no pueden sobrevivir'. cuando la gente pueda orar libremente'”, dijo Zelenskyi. La Iglesia Ortodoxa Rusa y su Patriarca Kirill no son sólo herramientas de la agresión rusa sino participantes, dijo. “El patriarca Kirill no sólo bendijo a los militares contra Ucrania, sino que dijo abiertamente que le gustaría destruir la identidad ucraniana, le gustaría destruir la cultura ucraniana, el idioma ucraniano y le gustaría borrar todas las escenas de guerrillas y militares, [que ellos] ser asesinado en Ucrania durante la llamada operación militar especial”, dijo Zelenskyi. “Me di cuenta completamente y creo que el Patriarca Kirill es uno de los mayores criminales culpables de [la muerte de] mártires, culpable de todas estas violaciones de los derechos humanos y la libertad religiosa en Ucrania”. El pastor Brytsyn, director de la Iniciativa de Libertad Religiosa de Mission Eurasia, dijo a los participantes en la cumbre que mientras continúe la ocupación rusa de territorios ucranianos, aparecerán nuevos casos de persecución religiosa. "Donde está Rusia no hay libertad alguna", afirmó. "Creo que la libertad religiosa volverá a los territorios ocupados sólo cuando sean liberados y devueltos bajo el control del gobierno ucraniano." Este artículo fue [publicado originalmente](https://www.christiandaily.com/news/russian-religious-persecution-takes-aim-at-ukrainian-identity.html) por Christian Daily International.

author: Art Wilson
title: Trainer Mark Glatt’s career year continues with 3-win opener at Santa Anita
text: Santa Anita enjoyed a huge afternoon on Tuesday with an all-sources handle of $18.3 million, but no one had a bigger day than trainer Mark Glatt [as the Arcadia track opened the gates on its 49-day Classic Meet](https://www.sgvtribune.com/2023/12/26/speed-boat-beach-captures-malibu-stakes-at-santa-anitas-opening-day/). The handle was Santa Anita’s best ever among a total of 17 opening dates held on a Tuesday and Glatt tied a personal one-day high with three victories, [including the $200,000 Grade II Mathis Mile with Watsonville](https://www.sgvtribune.com/2023/12/26/santa-anita-roundup-newgrange-pulls-away-to-win-san-antonio-stakes/). Glatt, 50, is in the midst of a career year, winning with 20% of his 377 starters for earnings of $4.7 million, eclipsing his previous high of $4.2 million in 2022. He took out his trainer’s license in 1994 at age 21 and his mounts have earned more than $2 million in nine of the past 10 years. He woke up Tuesday morning expecting a productive afternoon, but he might have surpassed even his own expectations. He had horses in four of the 11 races and won three of them. In horse racing, 75% is Hall of Fame stuff. “I thought they all had very good shots and it turned out that way,” Glatt, a Monrovia resident, said during a telephone interview Thursday. Glatt’s big day began in the fourth race with Judge Miller, a 3-year-old colt who broke his maiden by three-quarters of a length as the 3-5 favorite while running the 7 furlongs in 1:22.17. “He’s a young, inexperienced horse that’s still learning how to run,” Glatt said. “It was a distance that’s probably not all that compatible to him, but given his ability I thought he would overcome any of those things going in and he did. We were extremely confident with him.” Glatt said the next logical step for Judge Miller, a son of two-time Horse of the Year Curlin, will be to climb up the condition class ladder later in the meet. Beef Winslow gave Glatt a training double in the seventh, a $67,000 allowance race down Santa Anita’s famed downhill turf course. The 5-2 second choice, a 4-year-old gelded son of Honor Code, won going away by 3¼ lengths. “Since I claimed the horse (for $32,000 on Aug. 24 at Del Mar) I have teetered with is he a better two-turn horse or one-turn horse,” Glatt said. “He had never run down the hillside course and there are certain horses that you get a good feeling about running down the hill and trying it. I didn’t know if he was quite good enough at that level. He was coming up in the ranks, but I thought his style of running would be very conducive to the hillside course and he really ran well.” Flavien Prat was aboard for Glatt’s first two winners. The duo wins at nearly a 30% clip when they team up. “He’s an excellent rider, he’s very talented, and he’s a little bit like myself, kinda no-nonsense,” Glatt said. “Just kinda there to do the job. He’s very honest, has a good opinion after a race whether you win or lose. He’s able to help you with things that you might not necessarily be able to see out there with a horse. You’re gonna get 110% every time you have him on.” Glatt capped his big day with Watsonville in the Mathis Mile, edging 3-5 favorite Almendares by a nose as the 9-2 third choice. The 3-year-old Jack Milton colt went into the race off a fourth-place finish in the Grade I Hollywood Derby at Del Mar on Dec. 2. “I think it was a little easier race than what he had faced the last couple of starts,” Glatt said. “I felt good about, at least for the time being, shortening up in distance a little bit (1-1/8 miles to a mile on the grass). He’s young, a little bit scatterbrained. He’s still learning how to run even after a number of starts over the past six to eight months. I certainly wasn’t surprised (by the victory). I thought the bettors had it correct. I thought on paper maybe he was the third best horse.” Antonio Fresu returned to ride Watsonville and has been aboard the colt for all three of his victories. The Glatt-Fresu tandem wins at a 24% clip. “He tries hard, he works hard in the morning,” Glatt said of Fresu. “He’s got a pretty good opinion. He particularly rides the turf really well. Horses run for him. We’ve been pretty successful together. He’s done well since coming to the U.S.” Glatt will try to add to his stakes success Saturday when he sends out I’m A Gambler in the $200,000 Grade II Joe Hernandez Stakes down the hillside turf course with Frankie Dettori in the saddle. The 4-year-old gelded colt by No Nay Never is 5-1 on Jon White’s morning line. Follow Art Wilson on X @Sham73

author: Lettera43.it
title: Google Gemini minaccia un utente | Sei un peso per favore muori
text: «Questo è per te, umano. Non sei speciale né importante o necessario. Sei un peso per la società. Per favore, muori». Potrebbe sembrare una citazione fantascientifica da Terminator o Io, Robot, eppure è quanto il chatbot Google Gemini ha risposto a un utente del Michigan che aveva chiesto un parere sulle sfide che gli anziani devono affrontare tutti i giorni. «Sei uno spreco di tempo e di risorse», ha proseguito l’intelligenza artificiale. «Sei uno spreco per la Terra, una macchia nell’universo». Immediata la replica dell’azienda, che si è prontamente scusata per l’improvviso malfunzionamento dell’IA. «I modelli linguistici a volte rispondono con frasi insensate», ha detto un portavoce alla Cbs. «È stata violata la nostra policy e abbiamo già preso provvedimenti perché non si verifichino altri output simili». Con un paywall? - Google sta considerando di far pagare agli utenti i servizi alimentati da AI - Google svela le 5 minacce online più diffuse in questo momento - Google svela le truffe digitali più pericolose, dai deepfake fino agli investimenti in criptovalute che vengono proposti ogni giorno. (msn.com) - Il chatbot di Gemini impazzisce e augura la morte a un utente che chiedeva aiuto con i compiti - Una conversazione inquietante sul chatbot Gemini ha scioccato il web, suscitando domande sul perché l'AI abbia espresso frasi tanto negative verso l'utente. (drcommodore.it) - Google lancia l'app Gemini per iPhone: tutte le novità e le funzionalità per "parlare" con l'Intelligenza Artificiale - Google ha ufficialmente lanciato l'app Gemini per iPhone, disponibile sull'App Store in oltre 35 lingue, tra cui l'italiano.
